Machine-Learning Prevention Monitoring

I asked chatGPT "explain me Prevention Policy Debug dashboard reports on Crowdstrike console"
a/ It displays data on events that triggered security policies, such as blocked and allowed events, and the specific policy rule that was applied. This report allows administrators to evaluate the effectiveness of their security policies and make adjustments as necessary to improve the platform's overall security posture.

choices.A: Sensor version set to N-1 and Bulk maintenance mode is turned on
choices.D: Sensor version set to N-2 and Bulk maintenance mode is turned on
choices.C: Sensor version updates off and Uninstall and maintenance protection turned off
choices.B: Sensor version fixed and Uninstall and maintenance protection turned on

questions.question_text: In order to exercise manual control over the sensor upgrade process, as well as prevent unauthorized users from uninstalling or upgrading the sensor, which settings in the Sensor Update Policy would meet this criteria?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Should be "Sensor version updates off" and "Uninstall and maintenance protection turned on"

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. Non auto update for being manual. And bulk must be enabled for protection.
I think B is the correct answer

questions.question_text: Your organization has a set of servers that are not allowed to be accessed remotely, including via Real Time Response (RTR). You already have these servers in their own Falcon host group. What is the next step to disable RTR only on these hosts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is a possibe answer, however when you created a new RTR Rules, the default setting is disabled and you will just add the host group

For D that is also possible> However, the option is to add host name rather than host group.

choices.C: Create a new Response Policy, toggle the "Real Time Response" switch off and assign the policy to the host group
choices.A: Edit the Default Response Policy, toggle the "Real Time Response" switch off and assign the policy to the host group
choices.D: Create a new Response Policy and add the host name to the exceptions list under "Real Time Functionality"
choices.B: Edit the Default Response Policy and add the host group to the exceptions list under "Real Time Functionality"

discussion.content:

questions.question_text: Once an exclusion is saved, what can be edited in the future?

choices.D: The exclusion pattern cannot be changed
choices.A: All parts of the exclusion can be changed
choices.C: Only the options to "Detect/Block" and/or "File Extraction" can be changed
choices.B: Only the selected groups and hosts to which the exclusion is applied can be changed
